Topic.Title: Situation worsens for White South Africans

Message.Msg: ...“Iv'e (sic) posed a challenge to atheists to prove my God wrong.” - preacher lew Seriously, lew? You’re asking people to prove something wrong that you have absolutely no “proof” of to begin with, other than a blind “faith” in a belief that you just happened to be born into? You’re spouting nonsense from an ancient text, the authorship of which you have no clue about. What’s more, you’re referencing The Old Testament, particularly the Hebrew Scriptures of Isaiah and Jeremiah, which were written well before your own religion was even conceptualized. “Flee out of the midst of Babylon, and deliver every man his soul: be not cut off in her iniquity; for this [is] the time of the LORD'S vengeance; he will render unto her a recompence.” – Jeremiah 51:6 Ah, praise the Lord and pass the ammunition, huh, lew? You clowns seem to be really big on vengeance…that’s not something that coordinates even remotely with my views on spirituality. And what’s up with Tyre?... “…after the end of seventy years shall Tyre sing as an harlot…And it shall come to pass after the end of seventy years, that the LORD will visit Tyre, and she shall turn to her hire, and shall commit fornication with all the kingdoms of the world upon the face of the earth…” – Isaiah 23:15 and 17 There’s your theme for next Sunday’s sermon at the KIan meeting, lew…”Finding Redemption and Salvation With a Seventy-Year Old #$%$.”

Topic.Title: Situation worsens for White South Africans

Message.Msg: Don't be ridiculous. Do you think that everyone who disagrees with your wacked-out interpretation of the Bible is an atheist trying to "prove the Bible wrong"? You're just picking for some sort of fight to validate to yourself just how super-faithful you are. Try some humility. There are many interpretations of God's Word. Why do you think that YOU are so special to have the single right one? And what an idiotic statement anyway. If something can't be "proven wrong" does that make it true? Your belief in God and the Bible is an article of faith, is it not? If, for instance, Saddam Hussein rebuilt parts of Babylon (which he did) and the US military built a base on the ruins of Babylon (which it did) does that destroy your faith in God? Now you stated that the Bible states that Babylon will NEVER be built on again, not even an itty bitty part. Yet it has been built on. Does that mean the Bible is wrong or your dogmatic interpretation of the Bible is wrong? I'll let you pick.

Topic.Title: Will Egypt Lead The WAY !!

Message.Msg: "To help settle things in the middle east ?? So maybe "T" Stock will do what it's supposed to ??" Wow. It's good to have a reminder of just how dumb most investors are. The reason T stock is not rising with the rest of the market is that it is a dividend producing public utility, commonly considered a "defensive stock". During the recession and the period of low interest rates, people turned to these stocks to protect their money and to get some income, so there was a slight "bubble" in these stocks. Now that the economy is improving and the Fed is hinting at raising interest rates, people are moving their money away from these defensive stocks. T is doing just fine and exactly what it is supposed to do. It is a great income stock at these prices. It's performance has absolutely nothing to do with Egypt, Obama or whatever else you heard Rush blame everything on today. And I hope that you are not managing your own money.

Message.Msg: Obama should stay home and figure out how to lead us out of the mess he has put us in. Message.Title: You got to hand it to old Mr. Slick
Message.Msg: Just when you think old Mr. Slick and his party are going to be held accountable for their actions you read the following as reported in the Washington Post: "The Obama administration will not penalize businesses that do not provide health insurance in 2014, the Treasury Department announced Tuesday. Instead, it will delay enforcement of a major Affordable Care Act requirement that all employers with more than 50 employees provide coverage to their workers until 2015." While the Republicans whale and moan with great gnashing of teeth, old Mr. Slick just winks and laughs at their feeble attempts to play in big boy politics. Let's face it folks the current leaders of the Republican party are nothing more than feckless wonderers in the political landscape and deserve to be primaryed and replaced. Again you sure got to hand it to old Mr. Slick. He sure knows how to play in the big boy game. "In your heart you know he is right." The Frogg
